title: Thunderbird marking ALL email as Spam
content: Currently running Windows 10 and Thunderbird 115.5.0 (64-bit). All new email coming into my Thunderbird inbox from my gmail account is being marked as Spam, red flame. But is left in the inbox. Earlier in the day I went to Tools > Settings > Privacy & Security and selected "Reset Training Data" thinking that might be how/why things were getting marked as spam. Several hours later I have 7 new messages, all marked as spam. I to Gmail's web interface and the messages are all there and none are marked as spam. I checked the Log of Junk mail and I do not see any of the subject lines there.
creator: paul.truzzi

title: When I try to send an email i get this error message -
content:
When I try to send an email i get this error message,

sending of message failed. cannot communicate securely with peer no common encryption algorithm. The configuration related to mail.look.ca must be corrected.

I have no idea how to correct this and have already installed the latest version of Thunderbird.

Thanks

title: Thunderbird message pane background color
content:
Hello,

I played a while with the developer tools for thunderbird but up until now I'm not able to change anything for the message pane.

I would like to tweak the background color and some margins but even if I put a change on the element the change is completely ignored/overwritten. Google was not able to point me in the right direction either...

How can I do this? Or why seems this not to be possible? A link to a working solution/tutorial would be much appreciated.

Regards

title: email recovery
content: Hi, reset password in Thunderbird account and went to log back in and can now only access past 14 days of emails. One mail; folder has emails back to 2020, but no other folders have any emails available. How do we go about recovering these emails??? Cheers, Paul
creator: bagspc8

title: Email account password displays as long code
content:
Hello,

I'm new to Thunderbird and I was checking out the features of the Thunderbird app on my Windows 11 PC. I'd like to understand somethings with the passwords feature.

I see that the password of the added email account in the 'Saved Password' dialog box at Settings > Privacy & Security > Passwords, when shown is displayed as a long coded line, rather than the actual account's password.

Q1. Could you please let me know that is this done as a format to encode the original password?

It seems the app itself automatically does this, as I checked with this 2 times, by deleting the password and again approving the 2FA login credential when re=validating my email account.

Q2. I would also like to know that what is the real point of not displaying the actual password to the user when the 'Show Passwords' button is clicked?

Q3. Can you please let me know if there's some reason as to not having it display as masked characters representing the actual email account's password which authenticates with the email provider server, like many of the other email applications have it?
creator: intellogo

creator: brendan_cremers

title: Not showing entire article in news feeds
content:
Good morning!

Previously, when viewing an article in an RSS feed, if I double-clicked the header in the article list, Thunderbird would open the article in a new window in the client. After one of the recent (~6 months) update, I get a blank page or possibly a thumbnail image of something (very small). I have to click the link to open the article in my browser.

Is there a setting somewhere that directs Tbird to open the web page in the client vs. not? I looked at the "Allow remote content in messages" setting but it doesn't seem to affect this situation.

Can someone please help me here?
creator: david_lundy

title: Thunderbird still shows deleted folder
content:
Using Thunderbird 115.5.0 on a Mac. I started using Thunderbird around 3 weeks ago.

I added several of my accounts. On some accounts, it shows folders that I have deleted months or years ago. They were not visible in Outlook or on the web interface. Now they are visible in Thunderbird.

These folders are shown in italics and greyed out. I cannot delete them in Thunderbird or interact with them in any useful way. They are just annoying. Any way to get them removed? Or at least hidden?

Thanks
creator: matthias.nagy

title: ESET antivirus security detections on specific Thunderbird Gmail emails
content:
Hello,

Looking for your expertise on this scenario. Would really appreciate any advise.

Thunderbird is syncing on my Windows 11 PC newly and it's working fine. However, I use ESET's security solution with their ESET Internet Security anti-virus product and it has detected some security incidents with some specific Gmail label that have emails within the Thunderbird folders. Also, the usual ESET scan doesn't catch these. I had discussed with ESET technical support and they said that the 'In -Depth' scan feature needs to be used for the scanner to get inside the compressed file to search inside it and then it will check for security detections. Other way would be to extract the compressed file to a folder and then run a usual scan on the extracted items. But, as explained below, the compressed specific Thunderbird file can't seem to be extracted either.

I was trying to extract the specific Thunderbird file which has been detected in the real time system background scan, with 7-Zip as it shows the 'Extract' option. But, it doesn't extract and gives an error that it couldn't extract the specific Thunderbird file.

The specific file name is a label in my Gmail mailbox which has some emails, which Thunderbird has downloaded to it's cache.

Q: So, could anyone please let me know how do I extract or view which specific email item within the single specific Thunderbird file 'PG Campus.file' could the email item be in that may be infected, or whatever security issue has been detected?

3 Screenshot attached for your ref.

Security detection of one of them is at: C:\Users\User\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\o9rhi2hm.default-release\ImapMail\imap.gmail.com\Career.sbd\NID.sbd\PG Campus

The 'PG Campus' label based filed has no filename extension, but it has a size of 5.5 MB which has 58 emails as I checked on the Gmail web mail.
creator: intellogo

title: thunderbird headers > normal sender no longer displayed
content: The header below the list of emails and above the body of the selected email no longer shows the sender. Which seems really bizarre. I found under View either Headers - All or Headers - Normal. Headers - All gives it all plus the kitchen sink, twenty or thirty lines with a scroll bar. Headers - Normal just gives the subject, and the recipient - me. Which is a bit redundant! How can I get back to pre makeover headers?
creator: triplemaya

title: Junk mail controlsI have set up my junk mail control
content: I have set up my junk mail controls as described in the support literature, and while junk messages reliably have the red junk tag set, they still appear in my in box(s), rather than going directly to the junk folder as I intend. If I manually (re)mark them as junk then they do immediately go into the junk folder. How can I make them go directly to the junk folder rather than to the inbox? My email accounts are also accessed by my iPhone via Mail (since there is no iPhone Thunderbird app). Could this be related to my problem?
creator: j.klems

title: Gmail/Thunderbird
content: Long ago when Thunderbird came out, I drop outlook. Since then I've always used thunderbird for emails. I called it my one stop shop for all my emails coming in from different places to read my emails. Since this last update (which really needs works on or a patch needs to go out) this is my problem. Before the upgrade in Thunderbird, I had 5 different accounts. 1 from AOL (My main email), 1 from yahoo.com, and 3 from Gmail. After the upgrade, I had to delete the 3 from Gmail because it stop working as I wouldn't get anymore emails. I tried several times to recreate an account, and after I got to the part where Thunderbird would ping Gmail and said I was good, then another error came up and said, it couldn't reach the server. So before writing this email to the support of thunderbird, I tried a test. I can send an email from my AOL account to my Gmail account. I can then reply to the email from Gmail to AOL account. I then sent an email from Gmail account to AOL account and then reply from AOL account back to Gmail and it worked. So what is the problem with the middle man (Thunderebird)? Thank You Dan
creator: timlab55
